subject: AI & Agents
title: User Data in Inference: Who Sees Your Prompts?
description: A fast breakdown of User Data in Inference: Who Sees Your Prompts? for builders.

hook.text: You paste confidential code into ChatGPT. Where does that data go?

buildup.text: API providers may log prompts for abuse monitoring, debugging, or model improvement.

discovery.text: Some providers offer zero-retention options: your data is processed and immediately discarded.

twist.text: Even with zero retention, data transits servers. Encryption in transit is necessary but not sufficient.

climax.text: For sensitive workloads, self-host the model or use a provider with SOC 2 / HIPAA compliance.

punchline.text: Read the data policy before you paste.

quiz.question: What does zero-retention mean for AI API providers?
options: Prompts are processed and immediately discarded
The model is deleted after each call
